# The `MemoryDependenceResults` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Provides a lazy, caching interface for making common memory aliasing information queries, backed by LLVM&#39;s alias analysis passes. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MemoryDependenceResults</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Provides a lazy, caching interface for making common memory aliasing information queries, backed by LLVM&#39;s alias analysis passes.

The dependency information returned is somewhat unusual, but is pragmatic. If queried about a store or call that might modify memory, the analysis will return the instruction&#91;s&#93; that may either load from that memory or store to it. If queried with a load or call that can never modify memory, the analysis will return calls and stores that might modify the pointer, but generally does not return loads unless a) they are volatile, or b) they load from <em>must-aliased</em> pointers. Returning a dependence on must-alias&#39;d pointers instead of all pointers interacts well with the internal caching mechanism.

Definition at line 271 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>.

## Private Member Typedefs

### BBSkipFirstBlockPair {#a7f7a0fff3b6b76c1dec6d4e4267822ce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::MemoryDependenceResults::BBSkipFirstBlockPair =  PointerIntPair&lt;BasicBlock &#42;, 1, bool&gt;</>}>
This pair is used when caching information for a block.

If the pointer is null, the cache value is not a full query that starts at the specified block. If non-null, the bool indicates whether or not the contents of the block was skipped.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00289">289</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### CachedNonLocalPointerInfo {#abb7ec7e0ef71b031bbb984f7bc7ad9b3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::MemoryDependenceResults::CachedNonLocalPointerInfo = 
      DenseMap&lt;ValueIsLoadPair, NonLocalPointerInfo&gt;</>}>
This map stores the cached results of doing a pointer lookup at the bottom of a block.

The key of this map is the pointer+isload bit, the value is a list of &lt;bb-&gt;result&gt; mappings.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00322">322</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getInvariantGroupPointerDependency() {#a81ed5939e93e21552b452f5f82a73a38}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemDepResult MemoryDependenceResults::getInvariantGroupPointerDependency (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42; LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB)</>}>
This analysis looks for other loads and stores with invariant.group metadata and the same pointer operand.

Returns Unknown if it does not find anything, and Def if it can be assumed that 2 instructions load or store the same value and NonLocal which indicate that non-local Def was found, which can be retrieved by calling getNonLocalPointerDependency with the same queried instruction.

### getNonLocalCallDependency() {#aa7240503037f0c0499222a41a5f22d06}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MemoryDependenceResults::NonLocalDepInfo &amp; MemoryDependenceResults::getNonLocalCallDependency (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; QueryCall)</>}>
Perform a full dependency query for the specified call, returning the set of blocks that the value is potentially live across.

The returned set of results will include a &quot;NonLocal&quot; result for all blocks where the value is live across.

This method assumes the instruction returns a &quot;NonLocal&quot; dependency within its own block.

This returns a reference to an internal data structure that may be invalidated on the next non-local query or when an instruction is removed. Clients must copy this data if they want it around longer than that.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00401">401</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp/#l00718">718</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getNonLocalPointerDependency() {#ab46fb372d99dc0562d09cfdcd041d5ab}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MemoryDependenceResults::getNonLocalPointerDependency (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; QueryInst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/nonlocaldepresult">NonLocalDepResult</a> &gt; &amp; Result)</>}>
Perform a full dependency query for an access to the QueryInst&#39;s specified memory location, returning the set of instructions that either define or clobber the value.

Warning: For a volatile query instruction, the dependencies will be accurate, and thus usable for reordering, but it is never legal to remove the query instruction.

This method assumes the pointer has a &quot;NonLocal&quot; dependency within QueryInst&#39;s parent basic block.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00413">413</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp/#l00842">842</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPointerDependencyFrom() {#a2f2f5f9e9837f7f9010c8a26cbd04f6f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemDepResult MemoryDependenceResults::getPointerDependencyFrom (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; Loc, bool isLoad, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> ScanIt, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; QueryInst=nullptr, unsigned &#42; Limit=nullptr)</>}>
Returns the instruction on which a memory location depends.

If isLoad is true, this routine ignores may-aliases with read-only operations. If isLoad is false, this routine ignores may-aliases with reads from read-only locations. If possible, pass the query instruction as well; this function may take advantage of the metadata annotated to the query instruction to refine the result. <code>Limit</code> can be used to set the maximum number of instructions that will be examined to find the pointer dependency. On return, it will be set to the number of instructions left to examine. If a null pointer is passed in, the limit will default to the value of -memdep-block-scan-limit.

Note that this is an uncached query, and thus may be inefficient.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00448">448</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp/#l00268">268</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Invalidates cached information about the specified pointer, because it may be too conservative in memdep.

This is an optional call that can be used when the client detects an equivalence between the pointer and some other value and replaces the other value with ptr. This can make Ptr available in more places that cached info does not necessarily keep.

### getNonLocalPointerDepFromBB() {#a6f09518d625c6cf9b18c25476c120100}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MemoryDependenceResults::getNonLocalPointerDepFromBB (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; QueryInst, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phitransaddr">PHITransAddr</a> &amp; Pointer, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; Loc, bool isLoad, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; StartBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/nonlocaldepresult">NonLocalDepResult</a> &gt; &amp; Result, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldensemap">SmallDenseMap</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, 16 &gt; &amp; Visited, bool SkipFirstBlock=false, bool IsIncomplete=false)</>}>
Perform a dependency query based on pointer/pointeesize starting at the end of StartBB.

Add any clobber/def results to the results vector and keep track of which blocks are visited in &#39;Visited&#39;.

This has special behavior for the first block queries (when SkipFirstBlock is true). In this special case, it ignores the contents of the specified block and starts returning dependence info for its predecessors.

This function returns true on success, or false to indicate that it could not compute dependence information for some reason. This should be treated as a clobber dependence on the first instruction in the predecessor block.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h/#l00490">490</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-h">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp/#l01037">1037</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorydependenceanalysis-cpp">MemoryDependenceAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
